step1.sentence: After a stranger paid for her coffee, she decided to pay it forward by covering the next person's order.

step2.story: When Marcus got a scholarship that changed his life, he vowed to pay it forward once he was established. Years later, he funded a student from his old neighborhood through college. Watching her graduate, he felt the cycle of generosity had come full circle.

step3.story: Lena had been struggling to make rent when a coworker quietly covered her share of the office birthday gift so she wouldn't feel embarrassed. She never forgot that small act of grace. A year later, when the company was thriving and Lena had been promoted, she noticed a new intern looking anxious before a client lunch. Without a word, she slipped the intern enough cash for a proper meal. 'Just pay it forward someday,' she said with a smile. The intern blinked, surprised, and nodded — already thinking of how she'd pass on the kindness.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 누군가에게 받은 친절이나 도움을 그 사람에게 돌려주는 대신, 제3자에게 전달한다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 선행의 연쇄를 이어간다는 개념으로, 자신이 받은 호의나 혜택을 다른 누군가에게 베풀어 선순환을 만들 때 사용합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'Pay it forward'라는 표현은 1916년 릴리 하디 워너의 소설에서 처음 등장했으며, 2000년 동명의 영화로 대중화되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 보답(pay back)이 아닌 제3자에게 선행을 이어준다는 점에서 이타적이고 따뜻한 뉘앙스를 가지며, 주로 긍정적·감동적인 맥락에서 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He helped me when I was new, so I try to pay it forward by mentoring junior employees.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그가 내가 신입이었을 때 도와줬기 때문에, 나는 후배 직원들을 멘토링함으로써 선행을 전달하려고 합니다.
